Title:
Molecular taxonomy and phylogenetics of selected forest
lignicolous fungal species
Keywords:
Fomitopsis, Hymenopellis, internal transcribed spacer,
Polyporus, rDNA, Serbia
Abstract:
Since the lack of molecular studies within genera
Fomitopsis, Polyporus and Hymenopellis and data gap of species from the
Balkan region, the aim of this study was to evaluate taxa affiliations
of selected autochtonous lignicolous fungal species (Fomitopsis pinicola
(Sw.) P. Karst., Polyporus varius (Pers.) Fr. and Hymenopellis radicata
(Relhan) R.H. Petersen) from several mountain forest ecosystems in
Serbia (Tara, Kopaonik and Stara planina), as well as reveal their
phylogenetic relations with same and related species from other parts of
the world. Species identification was done by combining morphological
and molecular data employing ITS1 - 5.8S - ITS2 region of rDNA.
Phylogenetic trees were constructed and average genetic distances were
discussed based on information obtained from the sequence analysis of
sampled species and their comparison to 197 sequences from NCBI and
UNITES databases. In order to estimate the importance of polymorphism
within different sequences for their specific grouping in the
phylogenetic tree, all relevant sequences were analyzed by employing
alignment tool as well as looking for their specific polymorphic sites
within main clade of each analyzed species. For the first time, inter
and intraspecific relations as well as genetic origin of each selected
species from the region of Serbia was revealed. Serbian fungal isolates
comprise a specific genetic group within species Fomitopsis pinicola,
Polyporus varius and Hymenopellis radicata, as well as fall into the
clades with European origin. A phylogenetic gap between Serbian species
and other phylogenetically related ones could implicate that they are
eventually evolutionary conserved, supporting the high conservation
priority of Balkan Peninsulas forest ecosystems.
